CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 7, 1945, pg. 8, reads: "Easter Week Visitors Have Gay Time - Taking part in glamorous Easter parade over the weekend was a group of out-of-towners. Shown above in all their splendor were various visitors to Smoketown...Top center: Dinner given for Miss Schalk and Mrs .Rainey in Stanley's Cocktail Lounge shows, left to right: Mrs. Chester E. Harris, Mrs. William Houston, Miss Toki Schalk, Mrs. Dorothy R. Rainey of Washington, Miss Bali Schalk of Boston, Mrs. J. Shepard Smith, and Mrs. John Butler....Miss Schalks' and Mrs. Woodson's photo by Sockwell; remainder by Harris."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, from left: Mrs. Chester E. Harris, Mrs. William Houston, Toki Schalk, Dorothy R. Rainey, Bali Schalk, Mrs. J. Shepard Smith, and Mrs. John Butler seated at table in Stanley's Cocktail Lounge
